## ğŸ”§ Setup Instructions

### Option 1: Google Colab (Recommended for Beginners)
1. Click the "Open in Colab" link above
2. Sign in with your Google account
3. You're ready to go! No local installation needed

### Option 2: Local Setup
```bash
# Clone the repository
git clone https://github.com/jinming99/learn-ml-by-building.git
cd learn-ml-by-building

# Create virtual environment
python -m venv ml-env
source ml-env/bin/activate  # On Windows: ml-env\Scripts\activate

# Install requirements
pip install -r requirements.txt

# Launch Jupyter
jupyter notebook
```

## ğŸ’¡ Key Concepts

### Why Environment Setup Matters
- **Reproducibility**: Same code works for everyone
- **Package Management**: Avoid version conflicts
- **Collaboration**: Share code that others can run

### Tools We'll Use Throughout the Course
- **NumPy**: Numerical computing
- **Pandas**: Data manipulation
- **Matplotlib/Seaborn**: Visualization
- **Scikit-learn**: Classical ML algorithms
- **PyTorch/TensorFlow**: Deep learning
